questions.text: Whose dorm room was known as the "the shrine of immaculate conception"?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	She playfully told the press this at the end of the briefing.

questions.text: What sport did Josh realize he would never play professionally?
questions.explanation:
baseball.

	Donna: "You're just having this day today?"

questions.text: Did Sam ask Charlie to read the Red Mass speech?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Sam: "Would you mind reading it over for me and then hit me on the head with a fairway wood?" Charlie: "Yep."

questions.text: Ohio and Michigan were three states Josh said would be put into play. What is the third?
questions.explanation:
Maine.

	This was a conversation in the Oval Office about needle exchange.

questions.text: Amy told Josh that he shouldn't fly airplanes.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Stackhouse: "Josh, I think that you of all people shouldn't be flying."

questions.text: What nickname did Jeanette give Sam?
questions.explanation:
Cupcake.

	Jeanette told him she wanted to call him this after he played with her name.

questions.text: Who did President Bartlet say could pick one of his daughters to marry?
questions.explanation:
Mike Casper.

	Bartlet: "My oldest is married, but I can have it annulled. The Pope said he'd do it, I swear to God."

questions.text: On the back of what amendment did Anthony write a letter to Charlie?
questions.explanation:
First.

	The first amendment is the freedom of speech, press and religion. The second amendment is the right to bear arms. The thirteenth amendment is the freedom from slavery. The fifteenth amendment is the freedom to vote.

questions.text: How many books did Josh name that Tomba cribbed to write his book?
questions.explanation:
2.

	The books were Immanuel Kant's 'Critique of Practical Reason' and Plato's 'The Republic'.

questions.text: How many debates did CJ ask Toby to agree the President should have?
